citeinfo.origin: Gerald A. Sanger, National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)
citeinfo.title: Food Web Structure and Trophic Relations of Bering Sea Avifauna (Preliminary Report)

abstract.p: This report summarizes published and unpublished information on population sizes, seasonal changes in distribution and abundance and feeding behavior and food habits of murres (Uria spp.) and short-tailed shearwaters (Puffinus tenuirostris) in the eastern Bering Sea. This report is largely a compilation of basic information in tabular form and has minimal explanatory text.

[Reference: Sanger, Gerald A. Food Web Structure and Trophic Relations of Bering Sea Avifauna (Preliminary Report). Seattle, Wash. : Northwest and Alaska Fisheries Center, National Marine Fisheries Service, National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, [1977] "Final Report, RU-77" 13 pages. ] A copy of this report is available at the NOAA Seattle NMML Library.

descript.purpose: A report with data collected showing a food web structure and trophic relations of Bering Sea avifauna (Preliminary Report)

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system.
